subject: Re:Re: Ask some questions about source code of JUnit
msgSnippet: Dear J. B. Rainsberger, ... Thank you, I find it. But I still don t understand how BaseTestRunner implement the interface TestRunListener. In class
messageBody:
Dear J. B. Rainsberger,

>> 2, what is the use of the interface TestRunListener? I can only find
>> the constants in it called, but the methods implemented in
>> BaseTestRunner is abstract and have no code, they are just left to be
>> extended?
>
>Look at the three test runners for details.

Thank you, I find it.
But I still don't understand how BaseTestRunner implement the interface TestRunListener.
In class BaseTestRunner, there is an explanation "// TestRunListener implementation" before "public abstract void testStarted(String testName);" Then how can BaseTestRunner implement it? The signature of BaseTestRunner is "public abstract class BaseTestRunner implements TestListener", so it implements two interfaces, TestListener and TestRunListener?

>> 3, the constuctor of TestSuite, TestSuit(Class), can only use
>> TestCase class (or its subclass) as parameter, then what if I want to
>> use other extended class?
>
>....such as what? How can you create a TestSuite of something else? Why
>would you?

Maybe someday I want to extend it. ;)
Just a joke.
The JUnit framework was designed to allow only TestCase inherited by users, wasn't it?
If someone wants to develop other test tools based on JUnit, should he also merely extend from TestCase?
Thanks again.


Regards!

Fei Don 2004-04-14
dongsquare@...
